intro: Hieracium niveobarbatoides, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
